means: [女子名] 迪莱特来源于日耳曼语，含义是“令人快乐的”(pleasurable)

sentence.Network_en: The British team did not disguise their delight at their success.
sentence.Network_cn: 英国队毫不掩饰他们获胜的喜悦。

sentence.Network_en: Good day to you, Bernard! It's a positive delight to see you.
sentence.Network_cn: 你好，伯纳德！见到你真高兴。

sentence.Network_cn: 精神治疗师们经常幸灾乐祸地批评自己的同行。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French delitier (verb), delit (noun), from Latin delectare 'to charm', frequentative of delicere. The -gh- was added in the 16th cent. by association with light

entry.def: Delight is a feeling of very great pleasure.

example.ex: Throughout the house, the views are a constant source of surprise and delight...
example.tran: 从房子各处看到的景色不断给人以惊奇和欣喜。

example.ex: Andrew roared with delight when he heard Rachel's nickname for the baby...
example.tran: 安德鲁听到雷切尔给婴儿起的绰号时，不禁高兴得大笑起来。

entry.def: If someone takes delight or takes a delight in something, they get a lot of pleasure from it.

example.ex: Haig took obvious delight in proving his critics wrong...
example.tran: 黑格显然以证明他的批评者是错误的为乐。

example.ex: I enjoy seeing your parents take such a delight in the boys.
example.tran: 看到你父母如此喜欢这些男孩子，我很高兴。

entry.tran: 令人高兴的人(或物);乐事;乐趣
entry.def: You can refer to someone or something that gives you great pleasure or enjoyment as a delight .

example.ex: The aircraft was a delight to fly...
example.tran: 驾驶这架飞机是一件乐事。

entry.def: If something delights you, it gives you a lot of pleasure.

example.ex: She has created a style of music that has delighted audiences all over the world...
example.tran: 她创造出了一种能令全世界的听众都感到快乐的音乐风格。
这份报告让环境保护主义者欢欣不已。

entry.def: If you delight in something, you get a lot of pleasure from it.

example.ex: Generations of adults and children have delighted in the story...
example.tran: 一代又一代的成年人和儿童都很喜欢这个故事。

example.ex: He delighted in sharing his love of birds with children.
example.tran: 他喜欢与孩子们分享他对鸟类的热爱。

means.word_mean: 1. a feeling of extreme pleasure or satisfaction;

sentences.sentence: "his delight to see her was obvious to all"

means.word_mean: 2. something or someone that provides pleasure; a source of happiness;
1. give pleasure to or be pleasing to;

auth_sentence.content: These recipes also delight with fantastic flavours and colours.
auth_sentence.res_content: These recipes also delight with fantastic flavours and colours.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: These recipes also delight with fantastic flavours and colours.

auth_sentence.content: Extroverts are fun bundles of energy that delight all.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 令人愉快的, 可喜的
stems_affixes.word_buile: delight快乐, 高兴+ful……的→adj.令人愉快的, 可喜的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 快乐, 高兴, 喜悦
stems_affixes.word_buile: de加强+light高兴→n.&v. 快乐, 高兴, 喜悦

sentences.en: Your new book is a real delight!
It is a delight for her to watch her daughter dance in the show.
sentences.cn: 对她来说, 观看女儿在节目中表演舞蹈是件乐事。

sentences.en: Your visit last week delighted us.
sentences.cn: 你上星期的来访使我们很高兴。

sentences.en: It delights me to have made your acquaintance.
Everybody was delighted to see her.
Her playing of Chopin delighted the guests.
sentences.cn: 她演奏肖邦的乐曲使宾客们感到愉快。

sentences.en: He delights to talk about his family in the office.
sentences.cn: 他喜欢在办公室谈论他家里的事。

jushi.english: That uncle of yours is always delighting to contradict me.
jushi.chinese: 你的那位叔叔老喜欢同我抬杠。

jushi.english: Why do you delight to tease me?
jushi.chinese: 为什么你拿我取笑寻开心?

jushi.english: He delights to talk about his family in the office.
jushi.chinese: 他总喜欢在办公室谈论他家里的事。
